contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=March 2013}} {{Infobox person | name = Carl Ritter von Ghega | image = Ghega-lithografie-kriehuber-1851.jpg | alt = | caption = Carl Ritter von Ghega, drawn by [[Joseph Kriehuber]], 1851 | birth_name = Carlo Ghega | ethnicity = [[Albanians|Albanian]] | birth_date = {{Birth date|1802|01|10}} | birth_place = [[Venice]], [[Republic of Venice]] (now [[Italy]]) | death_date = {{Death date and age|1860|03|14|1802|01|10}} | death_place = [[Vienna]], [[Austrian Empire]] (now [[Austria]]) | nationality = | other_names = | known_for = designer of [[Semmering Railway]] | occupation = }} '''Carl Ritter von Ghega''' or '''Karl von Ghega''' (10 January 1802 – 14 March 1860) was the designer of the [[Semmering Railway]] from [[Gloggnitz]] to [[Mürzzuschlag]]. Born in [[Venice]] as Carlo Ghega in an [[Albanians|Albanian]] family, he studied in [[Padua]], where he took the examination for doctor of mathematics at the age of 18. He began his [[engineering]] career with [[road]] and [[hydraulic engineering]] in [[Venice]]. Among other things he contributed to the building of the road over [[Cortina d'Ampezzo]] to [[Toblach]]. From 1836 to 1840 he was a construction supervisor for the [[railway]] track from [[Brno]] to [[Břeclav]], the so-called [[Emperor Ferdinand North Railway]]. During this time, in 1836 and 37 he studied also the railways in England and other [[Europe]]an countries. In 1842, entrusted with the entire planning of the future state railway, he made a study trip to [[North America]]. After his return to the state railway he began with the planning of the railway line to the south, from Mürzzuschlag to [[Graz]] and [[Trieste]]. The crossing of the [[Semmering]] was not believed possible, but as early as 1844 he submitted a plan for the crossing of the Semmering, with locomotives without an extra rail for gear wheels. Before the building was fully decided, he began to enforce the construction of [[locomotive]]s which could overcome such upward gradients. Construction of the ''Semmeringbahn'' was begun in 1848, and in 1851, before its completion in 1854, he became a [[knight]] (''[[Ritter]]''). Carl von Ghega was next assigned to the building of a railway in [[Transylvania]], but he could not see this project to its end because of his death in [[Vienna]] from [[tuberculosis]]. ==Notes== [[Image:20 Schilling Carl von Ghega obverse.jpg|thumbnail|right|180px|Carl von Ghega on the 1967 [[Austria]]n 20 [[Schilling]] note]] [[File:Zentralfriedhof Carl Ritter von Ghega.jpg|thumbnail|right|180px|Grave]] {{German title Ritter}} ==References== {{commons|Carl Ritter von Ghega}} *{{cite book |title=Die Semmeringerbahn: der Bau der ersten Hochgebirgseisenbahn der Welt |last=Dinhobl |first=Günter |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2003 |publisher=Grasl Druck & Neue Medien |location=[[Wien]] |isbn=3-486-56743-8 |page= |pages=228 |url=http://books.google.com/books?id=pk4CgIx3PFkC&pg=PA45&dq=carl+ritter+von+ghega#v=onepage&q=carl%20ritter%20von%20ghega&f=false |accessdate=2011-02-20 }} {{Authority control|VIAF=8181871}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Ghega, Carl Von | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 10 January 1802 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Venice]], [[Italy]] | DATE OF DEATH = 14 March 1860 | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Vienna]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ghega, Carl Von}} [[Category:1802 births]] [[Category:1860 deaths]] [[Category:Deaths from tuberculosis]] [[Category:Austrian knights]] [[Category:Austrian people of Albanian descent]] [[Category:Burials at the Zentralfriedhof]] [[Category:Infectious disease deaths in Austria]] [[Category:Austrian railway mechanical engineers]] [[Category:Austrian railway entrepreneurs]]
